message_1: What is the degree of the hypersurface in $\mathbb{P}^{n}$ defined by $x_{0}^{d}+x_{1}^{d}+\cdots+x_{n}^{d}=0$ for $d\ge2$ and $n\ge2$?
message_2: The degree of a hypersurface in projective space is determined by the highest degree of the monomials in its defining equation. In this case, the defining equation is given by $x_{0}^{d}+x_{1}^{d}+\cdots+x_{n}^{d}=0$. Since each term has degree $d$, the degree of the hypersurface is $d$.
